reviews.text: Unfortunately the hotel was abbout to undergo renovations, so at first sight things weren't all that pleasing to the eye in the lobby, elevator, and hallways. But therooms were just fine for a place to rest at night and get a good night's sleep. Nothing to write home about, but I didn't come home with bed bugs either, haha. All in all it was an average stay, nothing to complain about.
reviews.title: Average hotel, safe and a decent place to rest

reviews.text: I had a reservation for 2 months before I checked in 6/25/12. I was told they "had no rooms." However, when I voiced my displeasure, they "found" another room. The room was adequate and clean. However, the Internet connection failed frequently and was not secure. Also, at this time I am complaining to Marriott because the charge just posted to my Visa is considerably higher than what my bill on checkout was.
reviews.title: No room available even with prior reservation. Being charged more than checkout bill.
WOW - was I impressed!
reviews.text: If I could give this ten stars I would! Super value for the money! Clean and the friendliest most helpful staff I have ever encountered and I travel a lot! They met me outside with a cart and a cold bottle of water and a big smile! They also had hot chocolate chip cookies every afternoon. Our room was clean, a little bit small, but nicely appointed with a comfy king bed and a flat screen tv with loads of channels. The breakfast was amazing for what I paid. 4 kinds of hot breakfast sandwiches, breakfast burritos, fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, a batter type waffle maker, lots of cereal and oatmeals. Breakfast parties, bagels and breads. It had a friendly attendant that kept things well stocked too! They had a beautiful pool also. I would not consider staying anywhere else on a return trip to Ponca!

We had to have several family members stay at the Fairfield Inn during a recent family reunion. They all raved about the comfortable beds. However, the real wow factor was the service. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful on every shift. One of our family members ended up overnight at the hospital and the manager even sent flowers and asked about her!! Talk about going above and beyond. We will recommend this hotel in our town from now on.
reviews.title: Excellent Service!

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The pool was clean and the spa was very nice. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was a standard contintental, but the coffee was very good. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Me and my family stayed for 3 nights over the weekend to visit some family in town. Front Desk Staff was personable and friendly, helpful with area information. Room was clean and very nice. Breakfast was wonderful and great lady working the Breakfast. Will stay again when in town.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Clean, Best in Ponca City.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean. Management very pleasant and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, great coffee.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: We have been up here over several past months from Texas. The hotel is so nice, clean, pleasant. The prices are far lower than other, but the class is far above the other hotels in this area. The front desk is so happy and lively. Very friendly atmosphere, terrific service. Will recommend to anyone with high expectations. Got to love it. Stayed in Oct and Nov. Thanx Fairfield Inn - PJF
reviews.title: Best accomidation in hotels located In Ponca City!

reviews.text: We ended up here because absolutely everything closer to Stillwater was booked due to Homecoming Weekend at Oklahoma State. That said, the room was comfortable, the bed was really great and we slept well. The room air conditioner wasn't noisy, and we easily maintained a constant temperature, something I've had issues with at other hotels with similar set ups. My only real complaint was that the floors were pretty squeaky, and the person(s) above us seemed to spend A LOT of time walking, or pacing, or practicing their line dancing, or something. It began VERY early and went on for hours each morning, we wished they had availed themselves of the treadmill in the workout room instead.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, nice beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance to the hotel was in need of cleaning and the trash can was overflowing. The front desk personnel were excellent. The door facing to the elevator was in bad need of cleaning. There was a sign that the hotel was undergoing renovation as the door to the back was closed. the carpet in the hallway needed cleaning. The room was clean and the bed slept quite well. The bathroom was clean and there were adequate towels and amenities. The check out was excellent,. the breakfast area was clean and the food kept stocked. This was an excellent continental breakfast. We were surprised at the quality food items presented. Nearly all were packaged and not just left in the open as we find at many hotel breakfast. When I give this location a "five" it is being compared only with other hotels in this immediate area. This Fairfield Inn is no doubt one of the best you will find in ponce City. Having written this I would trust you would not expect to see grand hotels and restaurants in Ponce City as they don't exist.
reviews.title: One of Best In Ponca City

reviews.text: Our recent stay above was very unpleasant and we will not stay @ Fairfield Inns nor recommend them to anyone in the future. 3 night stay: 1st night: beds were very soft and we regularly sleep on much firmer beds. We requested a room change; this was granted promptly. 2nd night (room): beds were only marginally firmer, the door lock did not work properly and there were ants in the bathroom. We requested yet a different room again; it was granted. 3rd night/room: old mattresses, too soft again, hair dryer didn't work. On the 1st morning of our stay, the kitchen area was understaffed; the desk clerk was operating both the kitchen area and the desk. Trash was overflowing and ran out of some silverware. Though we were promptly offered new rooms upon request, I would think that after 3 different rooms in 3 nights, we would at least get an apology or a discount of some sort. None was offered. We will not stay @ Fairfield Inns anymore. Poor facilities, understaffed, poor maintenance.
reviews.title: Forget this place, cheap price is not worth it!

reviews.text: I'm not sure what the prices are for other hotels in the area but regardless this hotel was very nice and clean with friendly staff and great location.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ponca City Fairfield Inn for 3 nights during a business trip and was greatly impressed with both the facilities and the staff. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating. There were free tasty cookies, fruit, juice, and bottled water available in the lobby and the rooms were spotless and comfortable. There was also a pool, fitness room, and functioning sauna available which I made good use of. Overall, a very good hotel at a good price and it would be my first choice whenever I return to Ponca City.
reviews.title: Good Choice for P.C.!

reviews.text: We traveled to Ponca City for a wedding. I believe there were about a dozen rooms in our group. The hotel was clean, the breakfast is as no frills as you would expect but the staff was incredible! Everyone was helpful and nice. They kept checking to make sure we had everything we needed. They really were great. The staff makes this hotel special even though it really is just a run of the mill Fairfield Inn. (Be prepared for an incredibly small vanity / mirror area.)
reviews.title: Incredible staff, no frills hotel, clean

reviews.text: The Fairfield Inn rates a 10 on a scale of 1 - 10. The room was spotless, the bed was very comfortable, the breakfast was great, but most impressive was the service. The employees at the front desk went above & beyond to make sure my stay was pleasant.
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: During my stay they were remodeling this hotel. It looked like they were working on the upper floors first (there was a chute from the top floor going down to a dumpster) and as a result of rooms being closed off, I ended up being given a lesser room that I had booked. The remodeling is necessary - this hotel is showing its age and the two times I've stayed here I've encountered doors that were difficult to open and close. The work is being done during the day so it won't keep you up all night. Breakfast is average at best but at least it's free.
reviews.title: Remodeling in progress - they need it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place needs to be TOTALLY remodeled! Rooms are in need of maintenance. Mattress was the worst of our last 10 hotel stays. A/C vent in the hall was filthy.... a real good indication of maintenance not being done. If it had not been for great staff this would have been a total disaster.
reviews.title: Has To Be A Better Alternative!

reviews.text: Throughout our stay, the staff at this hotel went above and beyond! I called the Fairfield an hour before our arrival and asked for a room. David told us that they were almost sold out, but had one room with two doubles available for us. I asked if they could put a crib in the room as well. Upon our arrival, our room had already been prepared and the crib had been set up. There were mints on the beds and a small package of soaps for our baby. Every time we passed the front desk, we were greeted cordially. In one day, we were offered fresh chocolate chip cookies, popcicles, and water. Each clerk was friendly and greeted us by name if they knew it. I;ve stayed at about 10 different Fairfield's this year. This group was the most helpful of the bunch (and I've seen some great hotel staff's!).
reviews.title: The Staff Makes It Special

reviews.text: This hotel has the older Fairfled decor, and I would normally give a lower rating for that. The decor and carpet looks tired. However, they are scheduled for renovation October 1. When this happens, it will be a fantastic property.
reviews.title: Tired Fairfield About to be Renovated
